paragraphs.title: Export CloudTrail Events and Save Locally
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
import boto3
from json import dumps, loads

ct = boto3.client('cloudtrail', region_name='eu-west-1')
events_json =  ct.lookup_events(MaxResults=200)["Events"]
with open("/tmp/events.json","w") as fh:
    fh.write(dumps(events_json, default=str))

events_cloudwatch_json = []
for i, c in enumerate(events_json):
    events_cloudwatch_json.append(loads(events_json[i]["CloudTrailEvent"]))
    
with open("/tmp/events_cloudtrail.json","w") as fh:
    fh.write(dumps(events_cloudwatch_json, default=str))

msg.data:
df: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [CloudTrailEvent: string, EventId: string ... 4 more fields]

ct: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [additionalEventData: struct<LoginTo: string, MFAUsed: string ... 1 more field>, awsRegion: string ... 13 more fields]

root

 |-- Resources: array (nullable = true)

 |    |    |-- ResourceName: string (nullable = true)

 |-- Username: string (nullable = true)

paragraphs.title: Cont CloudTrail Event Names
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT EventName, count(EventName) as Count FROM cloudtrail GROUP BY EventName

msg.data:
EventName	Count
CreatePolicyVersion	1
PutRolePolicy	2
AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress	2
RevokeSecurityGroupIngress	3
ConsoleLogin	6

paragraphs.title: Display CloudTrail Resource Names
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT EventName, EventTime, CONCAT_WS(', ', Resources.ResourceName) AS Resource, Username FROM cloudtrail ORDER BY EventTime DESC

paragraphs.title: Display CloudTrail Events
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT awsRegion, eventTime, eventName, eventType, explode(requestParameters.ipPermissions.items), eventSource, sourceIPAddress, userIdentity.userName, requestParameters.policyName FROM cloudtrail_events ORDER BY eventTime DESC
